185567651.review: Adds little bit more thing to red alert 3

185563864.review:
[h1][i]“Who needs friends?”[/i]
~Yuriko Omega[/h1]

At this point, I guess, we all knew what to expect from the expansion. [b]Kane's Wrath[/b] already showed us that [b]Zero Hour[/b] expansion to [b]C&C Generals[/b] is used as some sort of a gold standard now and with [b]RA3[/b] being more [b]Generals[/b] than [b]Red Alert[/b]... Like I said, it was easy to guess what we'll get. Some new units, a new campaign with some new story in it, and, of course, the new mode to play. One of them “challenges”. Here's a thing, though. While on consoles [b]C&C3[/b] had pretty much exactly what we had in [b]Zero Hour[/b], on PCs it introduced us to a new mode called [b]Global Conquest[/b]. Which was some sort of a mix between our usual [b]C&C[/b] stuff and the grand strategy. Somewhat akin to what we had in, say, [b]Total War[/b] series. Expand your territories on global map and then, when it'll be time to fight, do things in action-packed real-time manner. Which, again, was our usual [b]C&C[/b] stuff.

The problem with [b]Global Conquest[/b] was that... It was clunky as heck. Came with some really cheap aftertaste too. It was more like a proof of concept than something to be enjoyed for years ahead. It wasn't an experience to make you return to it again and again, but at the same exact time, it made you want for something like that. Only better. And after the next game in the series came out, it was only natural to expect that. Unfortunately... No. It didn't happen.

See, [b]RA3[/b] was all about consoles. Up to the point where it felt more like consoles-oriented spin-off than a real deal. You know, [b]Sid Meier's Civilization: Revolution[/b] and stuff. I don't think [b]EA[/b] were the only ones to blame for that (it was time when everything went cross-platform, which made [i]huge[/i] impact on PC gaming), but still, that's how it was. Also, [b]EA Los Angeles[/b] did a pretty good job, so, it's not like I'm complaining or something. At least, when it's about the main game. Because “challenge mode” in the [b]Uprising[/b] is kinda... Disappointing.

I mean, it's just that. The same ol' thing from [b]Generals[/b]. Except even longer, since to finish the challenge here, you'll need to play through whooping 50 missions. Those won't be some long and complicated missions, but still, those are 50 unique missions with the unique difficulties and limitations. See, the thing about the “challenge mode” here is that you start with only some basic units in your disposal, and in order to unlock more you need to... Well, play the damn thing. Every mission unlocks one certain unit for one certain faction (you're free to choose which faction to use before every mission). Don't expect just going for the strongest suckers out there, though. You [i]will[/i] be able to choose, but your selection is limited and high ranking missions will only unlock after you'll be done with the early ones. In order to beat the challenge and see the cutscene (in which [b]Kelly Weaver[/b], the spokeslady for the [b]FutureTech Corporation[/b] will personally congratulate you), though, you'll need to finish all 50. Good luck.

Wait, wait, wait... What [i]the heck[/i] is [b]FutureTech Corporation[/b]? Well, those are our new baddies. And, as their name suggest, they can manipulate time. You're representing them in the “challenge mode”, while in campaign you'll face them in battle. Can make you think of good ol' [b]Yuri[/b] when you read about it, but the thing is... [b]FutureTech Corp.[/b] feels rather... unfinished. Yes, they'll freeze time during campaign, making you all “OMG! I can't move, yet they're attacking me!”, but aside from that? There's nothing really interesting about them. Unlike [b]Yuri[/b]'s forces, they're [i]not[/i] a playable faction, while in the “challenge mode” you won't even think about them. Like, at all. Just because instead of having their own, they're stealing technologies from the others. Rather smart, yet completely unsatisfying workaround, I must say. [b]EA[/b] hired some new actors to make “challenge mode” more fun ([b]WWF[/b] / [b]WWE[/b] fans would instantly recognize Hall of Famer [b]Ric Flair[/b]), but still... Meh. Let's get back to campaign, though. Except they don't call it that in the [b]Uprising[/b].

Instead, we've got a bunch of so-called “mini-campaigns”. And those sure are mini. The factions got only three missions each and only [b]Soviets[/b] got four. For whatever reason (insert that ages-old meme about [b]USSR[/b] here). Thankfully, there are not just three factions now. [i]No[/i], [b]FutureTech[/b] is not playable, I already told you so. The thing is – [b]EA Los Angeles[/b] decided to throw in some experiments. Remember [b]C&C: Sole Survivor[/b]? Nah, who am I kidding. Nobody remembers [b]Sole Survivor[/b] nowadays. It was a weird and failed experiment. Long story short, it was an online-only deathmatch game, in which players were able to pick up one of the units from the original [b]C&C[/b] and... Well, title kinda says it all. By controlling a single unit and picking up crates, we were supposed to exterminate the others and survive. The game supported up to 50 players online (which was huge, since it was only 1997), but... Let's just say it didn't work out. The whole thing felt like playing one of those commando missions against other people. In other words, without any additional polish, it just felt way too clunky. Now, why am I telling you that? Because that's pretty much what [b]EA Los Angeles[/b] did here, in this expansion.

Don't expect any online, though (I'll return to that in a moment). While revolving around [b]Yuriko[/b] (Japan's commando unit from the main game), the fourth campaign feels... Almost [b]Diablo[/b]-like, really. And thanks to how core mechanics are way less rough than what we had in 90s, I must say, I had my fun playing it. You want me to compare it with something? Think of those [b]Kerrigan[/b] mission packs from [b]StarCraft II[/b]. You know, [b]Nova Covert Ops[/b]. Except while [b]Nova Covert Ops[/b] will end up having nine missions across three DLC packs, [b]Yuriko[/b]'s story only has three. And honestly, that's totally not enough.

That's just the thing about the campaigns here. Those just aren't enough. Sure, it's 13 missions in total (which, technically, makes it longer than what we had in [b]Kane's Wrath[/b]) and for the very first time in history we [i]did[/i] get the expensive actors for the expansion ([b]Malcolm McDowell[/b] is one of the new faces), but... You know. Still not enough. What's interesting to mention, though, is a lack of co-op. Or any multiplayer. Not because it's dead this time, but because it was never a thing. You may [i]think[/i] it's because they wanted to make a nod to old-school [b]C&C[/b] (forcing AI companion on us in [b]RA3[/b] even in solo mode did feel pretty weird after all), but the truth is... They've just messed up quite badly here. I'm talking about balance. They totally overdid it with crazy-ass spectacular aspect, thanks to which balancing things out for multiplayer was just... In other words, no multiplayer for us this time.

At the end of the day, [b]Uprising[/b] is a pretty weird thing. New units are sure crazy and spectacular, but there's no multiplayer, while the campaign is way too short, while “challenge mode” is a bit too repetitive to call it the main dish. [b]Yuriko[/b]'s story is a nice touch, but again, it's too short and... I dunno. In a way, the [b]Uprising[/b] feels lost. Forced even. Like nobody really wanted to work on it and in the end devs just put some unfinished things together and called it a day. I would not go as far as downvoting it, but... Just make sure not to expect much, OK? This here is more like a cute bonus for those who enjoyed the main game. Not good enough? Sure. But it counts. I guess. Let's just hope they were saving their efforts for the next big thing in the series, right? *SIGH* Who am I kidding? See you in [b]Tiberian Twilight[/b] review.

184884920.review: 也算是为了童年的回忆，上车补票了。但是相比原先的红警，这代红警又有了很大的不同。可玩性还是很高的，但是也不知道是不是年龄大的缘故，现在打个中等敌人都费劲了。但是说到最后 ，推荐大家想买的话，还是等到大促的时候入手，还是非常具备性价比的。

184835807.review:
La expansión sigue la misma dinámica del juego base, podéis ver mi reseña del mismo.

Si acaso en la expansión los uniformes se acortan más, aunque las cinemáticas ya no tienen el toque adoptado por el erotismo en el juego original, son más planas, aportan menos humor.

Básicamente la expansión aporta cuatro nuevas mini campañas, de unos pocos escenarios, aumenta ligeramente el nivel de dificultad, pero tampoco es una campaña muy amplia, también introducen nuevas unidades más locas y determinantes.

Lo recomiendo porque complementa el juego base, pero a día de hoy, realmente no valdría la pena por si mismo. Es un buen complemento pero nada más. 

En otra época al meter nuevas unidades entiendo que al multijugador le daría un lavado de cara, pero a día de hoy, no te aporta mucho más que una mini campaña de 8 horas. 

Si lo encontráis en un pack de toda la saga por 4 pavos como hice yo pues es inmejorable, si os planteais comprarlo por si mismo por 5 pavos pues no es necesario.

184226805.review: I think Red Alert 3 is a great game. For someone who grew up playing Red Alert 2 and Yuri's Revenge it's nice to see the series get a revamp. I would hands down recommend this game to anyone that likes RTS games and anyone that wants to have a fun time. Since I grew up with Red Alert 2 this one isn't as good, just from a nostalgia perspective, but it is pretty close. If any of you are a fan of this series hit the like button if you want to see red alert 2 get a remastered version.

183650239.review:
ОХХХХХХХ БЛЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯЯТЬ....

Это пиздец.Полный ПИЗДЕЦ.Я с детства люблю стратегии : еще в юности,лет эдак в пять,отец показал мне C&C Generals,в которую после садика с пропитанными от радости мочи трусами бежал играть в генралов.
Недавно меня переклинило и я решил купить EA Play,благодаря вспомнил о существовании серии C&C.Лучше бы забыл.
Я поиграл в C&C Generals и Zero Hour,Condition Zero (мод,рекомендую кстати) и приступил к RA3.
Я не любил ее в детстве,скажу честно,не зашла она мне. В частности то что у всех наций свой метод строительства (не знаю почему но на Японии я не смог пройти и одной миссии,альянс дошёл до середины и совок прошел ПОЛНОСТЬЮ БЛЯТЬ В 8(9?) ЛЕТ.),не взлюбил я Ред Алерт. 
О боже. Я был таким говноедом раньше,ибо то что я познал в редалерте..ммм... 
Эта игра была прекрасна как она безумно крута. Я влюбился. 
Прошел полностью (снова) все ветки,альянс ,япония,совок.....
Но вот пришло время для НЕЕ. Red Alert 3: Uprising.

ЭТО.ПРОСТО.ПИЗДЕЦ.
НАХУЯ ИМБОВОМУ АЛЬЯНСУ ДОБАВИЛИ ЕЩЕ 1 БЛЯДСКИЙ САМОЛЕТ,КАКОЙ ТО РОБОТ(уродский кстати тот кто делал модельку опирался видимо на игрушечного нахуй),ЕБУЧИЙ СЛУЧАЙ БЛЯТЬ!!!!!
А ЯПОНИЯ...УУУ ЯПОНИЯ....
она так же говна кусок. если не играть блицкригом - вы отсосете даже низкому боту. 
железный ронин отсос. полный. вот если бы он ваншотал пехоту - оно того бы стоило. а так какуля.
ну прикольная плавучая  крепость,но применения я ей не нашел.

НО ВОТ СОВОООК....
тоже нихуя. бесполезный картонный каток,прикольный чистильщик,мне понравилось,жалко не добавили еще самолетик какой нибудь,ибо камон вертолетик миг и киров эт несерьезно,хоть бы десантник в качестве отсылки на ра2 добавили,поозооор

Сюжет проходить не стал,меня затянули чисто испытания. 
12 буревестников из 10 корявых переводов сша.

183541691.review:
对比《红色警戒3》，起义时刻增加了一些兵种，但依然显得较少。本作有些优点也有些缺点：
【优点】
1.音乐很好。每个阵营都有优势曲和劣势曲。
2.部分兵种设计颇有想象力！
3.保持了真人过场动画，本人挺喜欢。
【缺点】
1. 没有中文！即使说明中包含繁体中文，也没法修改，这是赤裸裸的种族歧视，这也是给差评的原因！
2.可玩性地图较少。
3.阵营少。只有三个。
The game lacks Chinese language support, which is racial discrimination.
